EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.95}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Farming Techniques on the x-axis?

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Yield on the y-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Yield on the y-axis is {0.56}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Poultry on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Poultry on the x-axis is {0.64}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Soil Health and Demand or the cell corresponding to Forestry and Technology Adoption?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Forestry} and {Technology Adoption} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Crops and Weather Impact or the cell corresponding to Soil Health and Yield?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Soil Health} and {Yield} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.41 to 0.48?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Pest Control, Cost), (Poultry, Demand), (Soil Health, Market Price), (Crops, Technology Adoption), (Farm Management, Weather Impact), (Farming Techniques, Yield)}.
